image_1.description: Super Mario Land is a side-scrolling platform video game developed and published by Nintendo as a launch title for their Game Boy handheld game console, launched on 21 April 1989.
Nintendo is the developer and publisher of Super Mario Land, mentioned as part of the example in the paper.
Game Boy is the handheld game console for which Super Mario Land was a launch title, as mentioned in the paper.

image_2.description: Super Mario Land is a side-scrolling platform game published by Nintendo in 1989, used as an example in the paper to illustrate how the KGLM works with entity tokens and relations.
Nintendo is a company that publishes video games, including Super Mario Land, and is identified as the developer and publisher of Super Mario Land, mentioned as part of the example in the paper.
Game Boy is the gaming platform on which Super Mario Land was released, and is also mentioned as the handheld game console for which Super Mario Land was a launch title in the paper.

image_3.description: Super Mario Land is a platform video game developed and published by Nintendo for the Game Boy platform, released in 1989.
Nintendo is a Japanese multinational consumer electronics and video game company that developed the Game Boy and published Super Mario Land.
Game Boy is a handheld game console manufactured by Nintendo, which serves as a platform for various games including Super Mario Land.

image_5.description: ENTITYNLM is a knowledge-based language model developed by Ji et al. in 2017, which improves a language modelâ€™s ability to track entities by jointly modeling named entity recognition and coreference. It has a PPL of 85.4 and UPP of 189.2.
EntityCopyNet is an entity-based language model mentioned in the context of evaluating model perplexities. It has a PPL of 76.1 and UPP of 144.0.
AWD-LSTM is a model developed by Merity et al. in 2018, which was outperformed by KGLM variants. It has a PPL of 74.8 and UPP of 165.8 and produced generic, common words instead of accurate facts.

KGLM is a knowledge graph-based language model that leverages knowledge graphs for accurate language modeling and outperforms other models in perplexity. It has the lowest PPL of 44.1 and UPP of 88.5 and is crucial for generating rare tokens.

image_7.description: A former U.S. President whose birthdate is being questioned in the image, with August 4, 1961 being the correct birthdate according to the gold standard, and used as an example to demonstrate the effect of changing facts in the knowledge graph on model predictions.
